name: NPR
text:
Megan Thee Stallion: "We need to protect our Black women. And love our Black women 'cause at the end of the day, we need our Black women."
https://t.co/dP6oFtbNu5

name: NPR
text: Dylan Farrow's new young adult novel — based on her own experiences — is about a plague-blighted land where a cabal of magical men have literally stolen people's ability to distinguish fact from fantasy. https://t.co/dEfg5Nuc2t

name: NPR
text: Exclusive: An investigation by political appointees into the Voice of America's White House bureau chief for anti-Trump bias is the latest act that may break federal laws promising its journalistic independence. https://t.co/G33Q9s6ppI

name: NPR
text:
You might've hoped the pandemic would cancel sick season — but the annual arrival of allergies, colds and flu is still right on schedule in the U.S.

Here are a few steps to improve your chances of staying healthy:
https://t.co/W1jFEG9bcX

name: NPR
text: Despite the less-than-substantive policy discussions at the presidential debate last week, Gov. Jay Inslee was glad that climate change was mentioned at all. https://t.co/jJE1SBOZRR

name: NPR
text:
Three scientists have won the 2020 Nobel Prize in physiology or medicine for discovering the hepatitis C virus — which led to a test to prevent the spread of the virus and drugs that have saved millions of lives, the Nobel Assembly said.
https://t.co/6LRTLixUnY

name: NPR
text:
Republicans claim, without proof, that right-wing views are being throttled on Facebook — despite publicly available data showing the exact opposite is true.

But that claim would be easier to debunk if Facebook was more transparent, former employees say.
https://t.co/pKQKsq9cbk

name: NPR
text:
As President Trump enters his third day of aggressive and experimental COVID-19 treatment, the White House is struggling to show it has the situation under control.

And inconsistencies between medical briefings and statements have only added to confusion.
https://t.co/gIn1cpzd8X

name: NPR
text:
This year's scientific Nobel Prize winners fit a familiar trend that's been happening since they were first awarded in 1901: They have overwhelmingly gone to men, especially white men.
https://t.co/ipNokbBAOA

name: NPR
text:
The Supreme Court begins its new term Monday with 8 justices.

And with a challenge to the ACA expected to be argued a week after the election, it could become apparent fast just how far right the court will move if Amy Coney Barrett is confirmed.
https://t.co/zcVR25m5Dd

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: #BREAKING: White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany has tested positive for the coronavirus, according to a just-released statement.

name: NPR
text:
The coronavirus spreading inside the White House is a stark reminder of the danger of relying only on testing to prevent outbreaks.

"A negative test does not give free license to forego all other safety measures," says a scientist at Columbia University.
https://t.co/191uFPAcsz
